abstract: The New York attorney general’s office is investigating 13 large retailers over whether increasingly unpredictable and on-call work schedules violate the state’s labor laws.
snippet: The New York attorney general’s office is investigating 13 large retailers over whether increasingly unpredictable and on-call work schedules violate the state’s labor laws.
lead_paragraph: The office of the New York attorney general, Eric Schneiderman, is investigating 13 large retailers over whether increasingly unpredictable and on-call work schedules adopted by some employers in the retail sector violate New York labor laws.

headline.main: Retailers Scrutinized for Schedules and Staffing
